intro: Calcitrapa eriophora, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a low-growing, perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in dry, open habitats such as dunes, coastal bluffs, and disturbed areas. The plant features small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. Its fibrous root system helps stabilize loose soils, making it an important species in coastal and arid ecosystems. Calcitrapa eriophora is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, showcasing resilience to drought and salt exposure.
